BiblioData.Title: POLYMER NANOPARTICLES COATED BY MAGNETIC METAL OXIDE AND USES THEREOF
BiblioData.Abstract: The invention provides nanoparticles consisting of a polymer which is a metal chelating agent coated with a magnetic metal oxide, wherein at least one active agent is covalently bound to the polymer, said nanoparticles may optionally further comprise at least one active agent physically or covalently bound to the outer surface of the magnetic metal oxide. Pharmaceutical compositions comprising these nanoparticles may be used, inter alia, for detection and treatment of tumors and inflammations.

2. The nanoparticle of claim 1, the size of which is less than 0.3 [mu]m, preferably less than 0.1 [mu]m.
3. The nanoparticle of claim 1, wherein said polymer has functional groups capable of binding metal ions selected from amino, hydroxyl, carboxylate, -SH, ether, imine, phosphate or sulfide groups.
4. The nanoparticle of claim 3, wherein said polymer is selected from gelatin, polymethylenimine, chitosan or polylysine, preferably gelatin.
